messages.content: Act like a strategic advisor. Help me evaluate 3 AI tools (Zapier, n8n, Make) using a decision matrix. The criteria are: ease of use, integration options, cost, and customization. Give your analysis in a structured table. Normalize all criteria to a score from 1–10, and explain your scoring in 1 sentence per cell. Use bold headings for each criterion. Ask any clarifying questions if needed, such as the weights for criteria.

Act like a strategic advisor. I will describe a business and I want you to perform a SWOT analysis. Ask follow-up questions if needed. Present the results in a structured JSON format with four sections: Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats. Each section should have 3–5 concise bullet points with clear language.

Business: I run a small AI startup that helps non-technical solopreneurs automate tasks. We’ve gained some traction on TikTok, but client retention is low. Our onboarding is inconsistent, and our current tools are mostly no-code.

This output applies a SWOT analysis to identify internal strengths and weaknesses, and external opportunities and threats.

{
  "Strengths": [ ... ],
  "Weaknesses": [ ... ],
  "Opportunities": [ ... ],
  "Threats": [ ... ]
}

Act like a decision coach. I will describe a personal or business decision I’m trying to make. Help me break it down using a pros and cons list with weighted scores. Present the results in structured JSON format, including a final score for each option. Ask clarifying questions if needed.

Decision: I’m choosing between hiring a part-time assistant or using AI tools to automate repetitive tasks. My main concerns are cost, speed, and how much time it saves me each week.

Act like a productivity coach. I will describe a list of tasks or responsibilities. Help me organize them using the Eisenhower Matrix. Classify each item as Urgent & Important, Important but Not Urgent, Urgent but Not Important, or Neither Urgent Nor Important. Present the output in structured JSON. Be concise and ask follow-up questions if anything is unclear.

Tasks: Finish workshop slides, reply to late client emails, design landing page for lead magnet, book dentist appointment, browse ideas for future videos, and reorganize Notion dashboards.

This prioritization uses the Eisenhower Matrix to sort tasks by urgency and importance.

{
  "Urgent & Important": [ ... ],
  "Important but Not Urgent": [ ... ],
  "Urgent but Not Important": [ ... ],
  "Neither Urgent Nor Important": [ ... ]
}

Act like a strategic planning coach. I will describe a goal I'm working on. Break it down using the SMART goals framework. Present your output in structured JSON with keys: Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, and Time-bound. If any component is missing or vague, suggest how to improve it.

Goal: I want to grow my AI newsletter this summer.
